simplesect.para: Auto-shoot mode enables automatic photo capture at specified intervals, making it ideal for time-lapse photography, surveillance applications, or any scenario where continuous photo capture is needed without manual intervention.

refsect1.title: Enabling Auto-Shoot
refsect1.para: To enable auto-shoot mode, use the --auto or -a command-line option:
By default, photos are captured every 1000 milliseconds (1 second) and saved to the default photo directory. You can customize both the interval and the save location.

refsect1.title: Configuring Shoot Interval
refsect1.para: Use the --shoot-interval or -i option to specify the interval between photos in milliseconds:

This example captures a photo every 5 seconds. The interval can be set to any positive value, allowing for very rapid capture (e.g., 100ms for 10 photos per second) or slow time-lapse (e.g., 60000ms for 1 photo per minute).

refsect1.title: Specifying Save Directory
refsect1.para: Use the --save-dir or -o option to specify a custom directory for saving captured photos:

If the specified directory does not exist, Cheese will automatically create it along with any necessary parent directories. If directory creation fails, an error will be displayed and auto-shoot will not start.

refsect1.title: Flash and Sound Settings
refsect1.para: Auto-shoot mode respects your current Cheese settings for flash and sound:

listitem.para: If flash is enabled in preferences, it will fire for each captured photo
If shutter sound is enabled, it will play for each captured photo

refsect1.para: These settings can be configured through Cheese's preferences dialog before starting auto-shoot mode.

refsect1.title: File Naming
refsect1.para: Photos captured in auto-shoot mode follow the same naming convention as manually captured photos. Each photo is given a unique filename based on the current date and time, ensuring no files are overwritten.

listitem.para: Sequential number for photos taken in the same second

refsect1.title: Stopping Auto-Shoot
refsect1.para: To stop auto-shoot mode, simply close the Cheese window or quit the application. There is no separate command to stop auto-shoot while keeping Cheese running.

refsect1.title: Use Cases
refsect1.para: Auto-shoot mode is useful for various scenarios:

listitem.para: Time-lapse photography: Capture photos at regular intervals to create time-lapse videos
Security monitoring: Continuous photo capture for surveillance purposes
Documentation: Automatic capture of periodic events or processes
Scientific recording: Automated data collection at regular intervals

refsect1.title: Combining with Other Features
refsect1.para: Auto-shoot mode can be combined with other Cheese features for enhanced functionality:

listitem.para: --borderless: Run in minimal borderless window while capturing photos
--topmost: Keep window on top to monitor capture status
